byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Louisville, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta. Jack Healy contributed reporting from Denver.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Republicans sweep Southern states in elections; Tea Party outsider Matt Bevin wins race for governor in Kentucky and Gov Phil Bryant wins re-election in Mississippi; Bevin's unexpected victory in Kentucky, where Democrats have held governor seat for all but four of last 44 years, hints at new era in state.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Bevin, a political novice, surprised some Republicans who thought he was too far outside the mainstream to defeat the Democrat, Attorney General Jack Conway.

headline.main: Matt Bevin, Republican, Wins Governor’s Race in Kentucky
headline.print_headline: Maverick Puts G.O.P. in Control in Kentucky

snippet: Mr. Bevin, a political novice, surprised some Republicans who thought he was too far outside the mainstream to defeat the Democrat, Attorney General Jack Conway.
